author: Ben Leubsdorf
title: U.S. Consumer Sentiment Improved in February
text:
U.S. consumers remained confident in February, with larger paychecks and a healthy labor market overshadowing any worries about stock-market volatility and rising borrowing costs.
The University of Michigan said Friday its consumer-sentiment index was 99.7 in February, up from 95.7 in January. It was the second-highest monthly reading since January 2004, below only Octoberâ€™s 100.7 reading.
